div.p: Natural History Museum, London, Museum Archives, DF/3/1/folder 42, Cranbourne, Australia 1861-1936.

For other copies of this letter, see bundle 10, no. 12, unit 11, VPRS 1095, Public Record Office, Victoria, and Museum of Victoria, the latter having been made by Ernst Heyne. University
i.e. University of Melbourne.

Deshayes subgenus of shells Capsella was established in 1854 in Proceedings Zoolog. Soc. London.
Deshayes (1854), p. 347. If you are thinking of the double use for plants & animals I have long found the number doubly […]
Heyne's copy at the Museum of Victoria has 'employed', but this is not a plausible reading of the original writing. between the vegetable & animal Kingdom growing so happily large, that I feel convinced (and have acted accordingly for many years) that we must rest satisfied with the improbability of serious confusion, and accept the [risks]
Heyne's copy has 'names', but this is not a plausible reading of the original writing. so far

As for our rival claim on the Meteorite I would suggest the good old test of single combat and walking on red hot plough shares to see with whom the right lies — unless indeed the British Museum would save it by sending me Abels one.
